00002 * $Id$          dac_speaker.c                           2010-05-21

00025 #include "lpc17xx_dac.h"
00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00028 #include "debug_frmwrk.h"
00029 
00030 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00037 /*********************************************************************/
00042 int c_entry(void)
00043 {
00044         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00045         uint32_t time;
00046         float rate =0;
00047 
00048         /*
00049          * Init DAC pin connect
00050          * AOUT on P0.26
00051          */
00052         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00053         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00054         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00055         PinCfg.Pinnum = 26;
00056         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00057         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00058 
00059         /* init DAC structure to default
00060          * Maximum      current is 700 uA
00061          * First value to AOUT is 0
00062          */
00063         DAC_Init(LPC_DAC);
00064 
00065         // main loop
00066         while (1)
00067         {
00068                 for(time = 1; time < 0x3FF; time++)
00069                 {
00070                         DAC_UpdateValue ( LPC_DAC,(uint32_t)(time*rate));
00071                 }
00072 
00073                 rate += 0.001;
00074 
00075                 if(rate >= 1)
00076                 {
00077                         rate = 0;
00078                 }
00079         }
00080 
00081         return 1;
00082 }
00083 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00084    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00085    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00086    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00087    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00088 int main(void)
00089 {
00090     return c_entry();
00091 }
00092 
00093 #ifdef  DEBUG

00095 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00096 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00097 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00098 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00099 * @return               None
00100 *******************************************************************************/
00101 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00102 {
00103         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00104          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00105

00107         while(1);
00108 }
